column3: I'm getting kind of tired of explaining this.  USE_UPNP=1 means UPnP is on by default.  USE_UPNP=0 means UPnP is compiled in and off by default.  If you undefine USE_UPNP by building with USE_UPNP=  UPnP is not compiled in any the errors go away.  Please do a bit of searching before submitting bug/pull requests.\n
OK, thanks for the clarification! Now if you pull my revised patch, people will get this clarification in `build-unix.txt`.\n
Now that is a great idea.  (and here I was thinking that was already in there) sorry for going off on you.\n
Your earlier comment was constructive nonetheless â€“ no offense taken. :)\n
